date: 28 August 2024

Kabila, Joseph (1971– ),

Source:

Dictionary of African Biography

Author(s):

jeremy richjeremy rich

Congolese (Kinshasa) political leader also known as Joseph Kabila Kabange, was born on 4 June 1971, the son of revolutionary and future president of the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC; former Zaire), Laurent-Désiré Kabila. Joseph Kabila’s mother was Mama Sifa Mahayana, who some have claimed was Rwandan rather than Congolese. Kabila claimed that he was born in the village of Hewa Bora II in the remote Fizi region of the DRC, where his father led a small rebel movement against the dictatorship of Mobutu Sese Seko. Some of Kabila’s many detractors claimed he was born in neighboring Tanzania, which would have made him a citizen of that country rather than DRC. Others even claimed that Joseph was not Laurent’s biological son, but no conclusive evidence has been furnished on this matter. Still other critics went so far as to say that he was really a taxi driver from Tanzania with no Congolese ancestry. Since his father was extremely isolated in the early 1970s, few sources existed about Kabila’s childhood, assuming that he was in fact the son of Laurent Kabila. He had a large family. Kabila’s siblings included Josephine, Cecile, Zoe, Fifi, Selemani, Jaynet, Anina, and Tetia.... ...
